entry.title: LUCKY CONEJOBEAT
entry.content:
ConejoBeat returns in the year of the ğŸ®! After Season 1, I wanted to do another big rave since Plus went so well last June â€¦ We return with eight DJs for a whopping six hours of music! (give or take) Also Nez shows off her perfectly round mousi buttcheeks.

Along with Sofa and the Committee, Iâ€™ve totally redecorated and expanded the venue to accommodate more people and freshen up the atmosphere for the new year. Iâ€™ve taken the graphic design and artwork in a direction that is pretty new for me! Much more blingy than my usual stripped-back and colourless stuff; I had a lot of fun with it.

Iâ€™ll kick things off as DJ Nezubo, followed by my partner Tansy as DJ Tanamala, and then my friends Sofa and Mellie as DJs Waterfairy and Conedog before a brief intermission. After the break, we have DJ Flown on the beats, DJ Doctor with beautiful tape-driven lullabies, DJ /f of Psalmus Diuersae with mind bending livecoded electronica, and last but not least DJ Emamouse with a set of all original music!

Stream and SLURL at conejobeat.com!

entry.title: conejoBeat season 1
entry.content:
Hellooooo â€¦ 0_o Itâ€™s been a minute huh â€¦ My website actually BROKE so I wasnâ€™t able to post about this back in October like I intended heh.

After the Egg Ball and conejoBeat+, I wanted to try something a little different â€¦ conejoBeat returned in October as a series of shorter ravesâ€”2 DJs back to back every Saturdayâ€”as conejoBeat season 1. The three mini-raves we ended up hosting went well (except when the third one got crashed), but it turned out hosting weekly raves was too much stress for the Conejo Council and I â€¦ and due to the short length of the raves, people kept asking â€œIs that it?â€ at the end of each one â€¦

â€™Twas a fun experiment, but we decided our original â€œBIG rave not so oftenâ€ format works better. SOOOO guess what we doing in February ğŸ˜ â€¦ eeyupp

Stay tuned â€¦ conejobeat.com Casa Conejo
entry.summary: Hellooooo â€¦ 0_o Itâ€™s been a minute huh â€¦

Some Second Life updates â€¦

Last night Tantan (shawty! ğŸ’•) helped me redecorate the conejoBeat venue a bit. Itâ€™ll be a while before the next rave, so in the meantime it functions as Nezuboâ€™s house.

The weekend before last, the Committee hosted the Conejo Watermelon Festivalâ€”a two-part event, Tanamalaâ€™s harvest party on the 18th and Reinâ€™s pool party on the 19th.

entry.title: after conejoBeat+
entry.content:
Last Saturday I hosted conejoBeat+ with the help of Sofa and the Conejo Committee.

It was a huge success! We had a couple blips (Traktor crashes and internet cutouts), but overall everything went smoothly. About 20 mins before the show started I thought I would have to call it off b/c Traktor kept crashing, but I managed to â€œfixâ€ it last minute. (It ended up crashing halfway through Tansyâ€™s set though ğŸ¤§)

We had six sets totalâ€”I opened the show with a 10 minute set of my own music; Tanamala kicked it off with an hour-long hardcore set; Qbert with an hour of alt. electronic time signature fuckery; Nanoray with a short but sweet set of glossy futuristic house, trance, and D&B; Karma Bitch with an hour of tickly ambient brainfucking with upbeat dancy moments in between; and lastly myselfâ€”I basically just spun techno live until I tired myself out â€¦ which took about 1.5 hours. It was a lot of fun and the venue was packed! Thank you to everyone who came â€¦ and stay tuned for the next one!

Download DJ sets

Media
entry.summary: Last Saturday I hosted conejoBeat+ with the help of Sofa and the Conejo Committee.

entry.title: conejospeak
entry.content:
The members of the Conejo Committee have developed a strange set of vocal tics and slang that have come to be referred to as â€œconejospeak.â€ It seems to borrow randomly from Spanish, Mandarin Chinese, Japanese, and other dialects of English. This is a half-serious attempt to document the slang my friends and I use.

Vocabulary

conejo (es)(noun): â€œrabbit; bunnyâ€â€”often used as an umbrella term for Conejo Island, Conejo Committee, and Casa Conejo.

neko (jp)(noun): â€œcat; feline humanoidâ€â€”see also â€œneko pillsâ€ and â€œneko mode.â€

baobao (cn)(noun/verb): â€œhug; cuddle; embraceâ€

qinqin (cn)(noun/verb): â€œkissâ€â€”often used as a euphemism for sex and sexual content (perhaps due to its similarity to â€œchinchin,â€ the Japanese word for â€œpenisâ€).

kawaiiness (jp)(noun): â€œcutenessâ€â€”alt. forms â€œkainess,â€ â€œkawinessâ€; see also â€œkawaii flow.â€

chunchy (?)(adj): The exact meaning of this word is unknown. See also â€œchunchiness.â€

caac (?)(noun,adj,interj): The exact meaning of this word is unknown. It seems to refer to some kind of consumable item.

salamoy (ru? id?)(interj): The exact meaning of this word is unkown. It seems to be used as a greeting or expression of joy, or possibly an expletive.

Pronunciation

  • The initial â€œthâ€ consonant found in words such as â€œthe, this, that (etc.)â€ is usually substituted for a â€œdâ€ consonant: ex. â€œWhat da fuck?â€
  • Certain vowels may be transformed or omitted: ex. â€œthe â†’ daâ€; â€œlol â†’ lawlâ€; â€œfood â†’ fewd,â€ etc.
  • Further, an â€œeâ€ may be suffixed to these already mutated words: ex. â€œlawl â†’ lawle.â€
  • As the dialect has evolved, it has become increasingly common for speakers to omit the finial consonants from such transformed words: ex. â€œgoodnight â†’ goodnaiâ€; â€œgood â†’ gew.â€
  • These vowely words are often drawn out and/or repeated: ex. â€œGood nai nai lawwwe lawwweâ€

Misc. grammar

  • The habitual â€œbeâ€ is commonly used: ex. â€œShe do be crazy doooooeeeeeeee!â€
  • Aux. verbs are often omitted: ex. â€œDis a whole other level.â€
  • Less commonly, articles and prepositions are omitted: ex. â€œHe went store.â€
  • Conjugation and plurality agreements are often ignored: ex. â€œWe was wolves!â€; â€œI saw they photo.â€

More soon â€¦ ?
entry.summary: The members of the Conejo Committee have developed a strange set of vocal tics and slang that have come to be referred to as â€œconejospeak.â€

entry.title: commencement
entry.content:
Iâ€™ve decided to rebuild my online presenceâ€”Twitter stresses me the fuck out. Constant political drama, 16-year-olds calling my friends nazis over stupid shit, etc. Plus, the character limits and overall formatting of platforms like Twitter donâ€™t really allow for long-form writing. Iâ€™m realizing I have a lot to say and I donâ€™t write nearly as much as I should.

I think itâ€™ll be fun to have something to look back on in 20 years and laugh at â€¦ or maybe learn a little from. ğŸ˜³

As time goes on, Iâ€™d like for this site to become my true home on the internet. Iâ€™m too young to have experienced it, but I miss the days of eccentric personal homepages and self-hosted blogs. Web design technologies have come so far since thenâ€”it makes me a little sad that social media platforms offering next to no customization have become the norm! My websites are always fun for me to come back to and tweak the style of.

With ncb0.work and my webring piraba.net, my aim is to bring that creativity back a little. Expect to see me on Twitter less, and posting more here and on Discord.
entry.summary: Iâ€™ve decided to build a more concrete online presence for myselfâ€”social platforms like Twitter aren't ideal for getting across long-form thoughts in the same way a blog can.
